div.p: This attribute is attached to PAUTHORSHIP and belongs conceptually to WRITING PRODUCTION. It allows us to distinguish those texts authored by more than a single author. It has one value, CollaborationYes, and three sibling attributes: AUTHORSHIPCONTROVERSY, CONTROVERSYDATE, and AUTHORNAMETYPE. See individual glossary entries for those definitions.

div.codeblock: <PAUTHORSHIP COLLABORATION="collaborationYes">With C. H. B. Kitchin and Alan Porter, VB edited Oxford Poetry, 1920.</PAUTHORSHIP>
<PAUTHORSHIP COLLABORATION="collaborationYes">Edith Somerville and MR published a sequel to their most successful book: Further Experiences of an Irish R. M.</PAUTHORSHIP>

div.p: CollaborationYes should be used in cases where the title page lists more than one author name, or when sources say that a significant contribution went unrecognized.
